result.execSummary:
The defendant Adonis I Mosay Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office - 60 days to pay or set up payment plan.  Failure to do so may result in warrant.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

No alcohol.  
No illegal substances.  
Not to have contact with: Heidi Halverson.  
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  
If not a U.S. citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must undergo COMPAS evaluation and follow through with criminogenic needs as recommended by Probation.
Must provide a DNA sample - no surcharge.
